intro: Artabotrys pallens, commonly known as the white star of India, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and emit a strong, sweet scent, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture.
